title: Rob Gronkowski throws shade at Patriots during comical debut as NFL on FOX analyst
text:
Rob Gronkowski retired from the New England Patriots last offseason. And since he hung up the cleats, he has been enjoying himself.

After spending the offseason going to a number of sporting and charity events during the offseason, Gronkowski has taken the next steps for his career. He announced a partnership with a CBD company and this week, it was confirmed that he would be debuting as an analyst on FOX's NFL pregame coverage team.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

As one would expect, Gronk's debut was comical. And here's a look at it via the FOX Sports official Twitter account.

"It's gonna be LIT!"@RobGronkowski has arrived @NFLonFOX and it's gonna be a party 😎 pic.twitter.com/QxefcF5gQG — FOX Sports (@FOXSports) October 11, 2019

While Gronk was reluctant to speak ill of the Patriots in the sketch, he did throw a little bit of shade at the team while speaking with the rest of the pregame crew.

"Let me tell you something," Gronkowski said. "Getting a deal done [with FOX Sports] was much easier than getting a deal done with the Patriots."

The Patriots have notoriously been tight with their money even when attempting to sign or re-sign star players. So, it's no surprise to hear that they gave Gronkowski some trouble in negotiations.

That said, Gronkowski's jab was one in good faith, as his relationship with the team seems to be nothing but positive.

Story continues

Rob Gronkowski throws shade at Patriots during comical debut as NFL on FOX analyst originally appeared on NBC Sports Boston
description: Rob Gronkowski made his debut as an NFL analyst on FOX Sports' pregame show ahead of the New England Patriots vs. New York Giants game. And he starred in a hilarious sketch to kick off his career as an on-air personality
